[Source](https://cla.purdue.edu/academic/history/debate/kennedynixon/kennedynixonscholarly.html)  It's genuinely important because perception influences how you think about a person, and how receptive you are to their ideas. Now if it was in his office and someone was doing his makeup every day regardless, that's insane. Hell, if he pops down to the green room for makeup every day that's insane. For setting up people who need to be on camera it's pretty sensible.  That and there's plenty to criticize Pete for, finally recognizing that the Pentagon runs a small tv studio which needs to be outfitted accordingly isn't one of them.
